item.title: Report X-2024060633
item.description:
Report X-2024060633

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE HAZMAT CLERK ALERTED RESPONDER OF A HAZMAT SPILL. RESPONDER GRABBED THE SPILL TUG TO HEAD OVER TO THE SPILL BY THE M6 CLERK. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER PUT ON PPE AND GRABBED DECISION TREE. RESPONDER SAW IT WAS A CORROSIVE LABEL, FOLLOWED DECESION TREE TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO CLEAN UP THE SPILL AND TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024060632
item.description:
Report X-2024060632

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-18T15:12:21+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-05
  • City: WALTON
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: THE HAZMAT CLERK ALERTED RESPONDER OF A LEAKER BY THE M6 CLERK STATION. RESPONDER PROCEEDED TO GRAB THE SPILL TUG AND DRIVE OVER TO THE SPILL. UPON ARRRIVAL RESPONDER PUT ON PPE AND GRABBED DECISION TREE. RESPONDER NOTICED THE CORROSIVE LABEL AND PROCEEDED TO FOLLOW DECISION TREE THAT LED THEM TO THE CORROSIVE RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND TOOK IT BACK TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2024060055
item.description:
Report E-2024060055

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-31
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 31, 2024, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN1487 was punctured by a forklift and released approximately ten (10) pounds of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from TPM Group to remediate the impacted site. TPM personnel deployed granular absorbents to the oxidizer-impacted dock floor and used a vacuum unit to remediate the site. All spent absorbents, and damaged product was collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon vented drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024060119
item.description:
Report X-2024060119

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-30
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was found leaking during the morning shift. Two admin handled the package and the contents got on their arms, causing a burning sensation. SCMS was entered, the Nurse line called, and their symptoms will be monitored. Upon being inspected during the PM sort, it looks like three of the bottles were dented and a leak resulted. The package was also sent without any markings- leaving it to be considered "Undeclared"

item.title: Report X-2024051832

  • Description: The box was loaded upside down inside the trailer before we unloaded it. I would very much appreciate it if we can some how put bags over these containers so we don't have an incident happen.
